result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Rashad Combs

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:30 AM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Nicholas Rashad Combs.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes matter remains unresolved. Court reviews trial to remain on calendar.
Transcript of Motion Hearing from October 5, 2022

2:30 PM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Nicholas Rashad Combs.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State filed a joinder request and makes argument to support request for cases 22CF209 and 22CF262. Attorney Hoffman is opposed to joinder, finds different victims in each case and makes argument. Court finds crimes are related and no prejudice. Court grants request for joinder for trial. 
State reviews motion to admit statements filed. State reviews Exhibits 1-10 that were filed in 22CF262. Asks for admission of other acts evidence. Attorney Hoffman is opposed to the admission and questions if evidence is that of defendant's account. Attorney Hoffman asks that motion not fully be granted today. Court questions of State what evidence at trial would be in relation to the exhibits filed. State calls Detective Russ Milroy. Detective Milroy sworn and testified. State direct examination of Detective Milroy. Attorney Hoffman cross examination of Detective Milroy. Court reviews evidence offer for permissible purpose and is relevant information. Court finds evidence is relevant. Court grants motion to admit other acts evidence.

8:38 AM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Nicholas Rashad Combs.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF262, Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hoffman asks for a trial date to be set and demands a speedy trial. State asks for pretrial motion hearing to be scheduled. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant has been in custody since around June 2 and has been unable to post. Defendant has lived in twin ports area for 18 years. Defendant would enter into MN Teen Challenge if released from custody. Defendant could post up to $5,000 cash. State is opposed to bail modification and reviews seriousness of pending charges. Defendant has criminal history out of Minnesota and several failures to appear. Charges occurred while out on bail in another Douglas Co case. Attorney Hoffman makes argument for lower cash bail. Court reviews factors in determining bail. Court denies request for bail modification in 22CF262 and 22CF209.
Jury trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification
Letter from Defendant to Judge Glonek
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Nicholas Rashad Combs. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas. Requests status.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order for Specific Judicial Assignment

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Nicholas Rashad Combs. State acknowledges receipt of motion. Attorney Hoffman indicates that defendant has been in custody since June 2, 2022 and has family and significant local ties. Asks for reduction to $1,000 cash. The defendant is able to post $1,000. State opposes reduction and notes that this offense was allegedly committed while defendant was on bail in other cases. Notes that most ties are in Minnesota. Recites defendant's prior criminal history. Defendant is no longer welcome at the address he has provided. Defendant gives statement to the court. 

Court believes $2500 is appropriate. Court denies motion. Bail and conditions to continue.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification

records.addlTxt:
1:56 PM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State recites crim hist. lives in duluth

Court modifies original cash bail order;orders 2500cb and all prior conditions.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:51 PM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court indicates the complaint wasn't received until late and there was no time to review for probable cause; knows that states request for initial appearance tomorrow.
State notes that court had already reviewed for probable cause and bail previously was set.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bond set - $5,000: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Must update address with the clerk of courts office within 24 hours of release.

1:28 PM Defendant Nicholas Rashad Combs appeared by video, in custody. Chad La Lor in court on behalf of the state. Ryan Reid in court on behalf of the defendant. Defendant provides address and acknowledges receipt of probable cause paperwork. State asks for $10,000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State notes the seriousness of the offenses and ongoing investigations for future charges. Currently out on $500 cash in another Douglas County case. Cites prior criminal history in MN and WI and 3 FTAs across those files and probation violations. Asks for initial appearance to be set in the matter. Attorney Reid indicates that the defendant provides a Superior address and has ties to the twin ports community. Has family and children in the area. Acknowledges prior record and asks for signature bond or $1500 cash bond. Court notes long contacts and family in the area. Notes concerns over being out on bail and being alleged to have committed more crimes and seriousness of potential future charges. Attorney Reid indicates that the future charges should not be taken into account when deciding bail in this matter as they have not been charged out yet. Defendant indicates reasons for FTAs. State notes that the defendant will not be allowed to return to address provided to the court. Defendant indicates he could provide other address. Court orders $5000 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Must update address with the clerk of courts office within 24 hours of release.
Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
